html:
3 February 2022 10:43 p.m. ​All figures in US dollars.

The profits announced by Amazon.com Inc in the fourth quarter were higher than the Refinitiv mean estimate of profits. The company reported profits of $5.80 per share, $8.29 lower than the same quarter last year when the company reported EPS of $14.09. Profits of $3.57 per share were anticipated by the forty one analysts providing estimates for the quarter. Wall Street expected results to range from -96 cents to $7.04 per share, with a forecasted mean of $3.57 per share. The company reported revenue of $137.41 billion, which is lower than the estimated $137.55 billion.

RECOMMENDATIONS

* The consensus recommendation for the company is "Buy".

* The average consensus recommendation for the department stores peer group is also "Buy".

FORECAST CHANGES

* Thirty five analysts are currently providing Refinitiv with estimates.

* In the last week six analysts have negatively revised earnings estimates and there was a gain of two new estimates.

YEAR OVER YEAR

* The company reported an increase in revenue to $137.41 billion from $125.56 billion in the same quarter last year.​

* Previous quarterly performance (using earnings preferred measure)
